name: Plateosaurus
description: Plateosaurus was Big Red's robot used in the FTC Frieght Frenzy season.

competitions.name: Houston-Southwest League Tournament
competitions.detail: **INSPIRE AWARD Winner**, Finalist Alliance, Design Award 2nd Place, Think Award 3rd Place, Control Award 3rd Place

features: The mecanum drivetrain gave the robot quick but strafable movement throughout the field. The wheels were bigger to account for the barrier.
The magnetic arm could lift and manipulate placement of capstone.
Bevel wheels meant the drivetrain took up less space overall and instead had vertical moters.
The rubber duck carousel span fast using a core hex motor.
The intake used surgical tubing to collect rings quickly and efficiently.
A bucket at the end of the intake could be lifted extremely high using a string and linear slide. A servo on the end of the bucket could tilt it and deposit the box's contents into the goal.

name: KARL
description: KARL, standing for **Knowledge, Accomplishment, Robotics, and Love**, was Roboviking's robot used in the FTC Freight Frenzy season.

competitions.name: Houston-Southwest League Tournament
competitions.detail: Connect Award Winner, 2nd Place Control Award Winner, 2nd Place Think Award Winner

features: The mecanum drivetrain gave the robot quick but strafable movement throughout the field. The wheels were bigger to account for the barrier.
The rubber duck carousel span fast using a REV core hex motor.

Our intake is fairly simplified to reduce risk of failure and breakage. It is composed of shaft collars, custom 3D printed brackets and lined up zip ties that were taped together. The zip ties were fastened to the brackets and spun around an axis by a core hex motor, in order to intake shipping elements and move them into a 3D printed box.

name: Red Titan
description: Red Titan was Big Red's robot used in the FTC Ultimate Goal season.
features: It could shoot all 3 rings with high accuracy in under 1 second.
Extrusion based system allowed us to use a mix of custom CNC'd parts and vendor parts.
Intake was geared to be 15:1, which allowed us to intake all 3 rings very quickly.

name: Tolerance
description: Tolerance was RoboVikings' robot used in the FTC Ultimate Goal season.

competitions.name: Houston-Southwest League Tournament
competitions.detail: Inspire Award Winner, Control Award Winner, 2nd-Ranked Team

competitions.name: Houston Regional Championship Tournament (In-Person)
competitions.detail: Third Alliance, Dean's List Scholarship Awardee

features: Webcam allowed for automatic aiming and shooter-power predicting through computer vision. It also used computer vision to determine the amount of starting rings on the field.
Rotatable claw with large gear ratio allow for strong grasp and handling of wobble goal.
Fast and wide intake allowed for quick collection of rings.
3-ring storage with servo-slider allowed multiple shots to be made in quick sucession.
Mecanum wheels allow for quick omni-directional strafing.

name: Artillery
description: Artillery was **Circuit Bizurkers'** second robot to compete in FRC.

competitions.name: FIT Channelview Event
competitions.detail: Quarterfinalist Alliance, Won Safety Award sponsored by Underwriters Laboratories, Won **District Engineering Inspiration Award**

features: Limelight allowed for accurately aimed shots aided with computer-vision.
Superfast flywheel allowed for flexibility when choosing where to shoot.
Deep storage allowed for transport of 3 balls simultaneously.

name: Ignite
description: Ignite was Big Red's robot used in FTC Skystone
features: Extendable bracket allowed for easy pulling of the Skystone placement plate.
Dual wheel intake and outtake allowed for effortless block grasping and storage.
Mechanum Wheels allow for strafing.

name: Inertia
description: Inertia was RoboVikings' robot used in FTC Skystone
features: Variable claw with a grippable surface allowed for easy stone grasping and moving.
Pulley allowed for easy stacking.
Mechanum wheels allow for strafing.

name: Javelin
description: Javelin was **Circuit Bizurkers'** first robot to compete in FRC.

competitions.name: FIT Texas District Championship
competitions.detail: Safety Award, Rookie All Stars Award

features: Rigid build allows for effective defense.
Fast hatch rate

name: Elephant
description: Elephant was Big Red's robot used in FTC Rover Ruckus
features: Extending intake for Gold and Silver.
Mechanum Wheels allow for strafing

name: Gearshift
description: Gearshift was RoboVikings' robot used in FTC Rover Ruckus
features: Extendable intake

name: Blowtorch
description: Blowtorch was Big Red's robot used in FTC Relic Recovery
features: PID programming enables wheel fail tolerance
Mechanum Wheels allow for strafing

name: Matchstick
description: Matchstick was RoboVikings' robot used in FTC Relic Recovery
features: Mechanum wheels allow for strafing

name: Box on Wheels
description: Box on Wheels was Big Red's first robot. It played in FTC Velocity Vortex.
features: Had an "Autonomous Button Pusher" that used Computer Vision to press the correct button on the field.
